events.name: Plane Crash Involving Yevgeny Prigozhin
events.wd_description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, leader of the Wagner mercenary group, was on board a plane that crashed north of Moscow with no survivors. The crash leaves questions about the future of Wagner's operations.
events.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, leader of the Wagner mercenary group, was on board a plane that crashed north of Moscow with no survivors. The crash leaves questions about the future of Wagner's operations.

events.name: Details of the Crash
events.wd_description: The plane, a Brazilian Embraer Legacy 600, crashed north of Moscow with no survivors. This model has only recorded one accident in over 20 years of service.
events.description: The plane, a Brazilian Embraer Legacy 600, crashed north of Moscow with no survivors. This model has only recorded one accident in over 20 years of service.

events.name: Reaction from Grey Zone
events.wd_description: Grey Zone, a Telegram channel linked to Wagner, confirmed Prigozhin's death and hailed him as a hero and patriot, attributing his death to unidentified "traitors to Russia."
events.description: Grey Zone, a Telegram channel linked to Wagner, confirmed Prigozhin's death and hailed him as a hero and patriot, attributing his death to unidentified "traitors to Russia."

events.name: Lack of Comment from Kremlin and Defense Ministry
events.wd_label: Lack of Comment from Kremlin and Defense Ministry
events.wd_description: Neither the Kremlin nor the Russian Defense Ministry has commented on the fate of Yevgeny Prigozhin.
events.description: Neither the Kremlin nor the Russian Defense Ministry has commented on the fate of Yevgeny Prigozhin.

events.name: Implications for Wagner Group
events.wd_description: The death of Prigozhin raises questions about the future operations of the Wagner Group, particularly in Africa and other regions.
events.description: The death of Prigozhin raises questions about the future operations of the Wagner Group, particularly in Africa and other regions.

events.name: General Brice Nguema Sworn In as Interim President of Gabon
events.wd_label: General Brice Nguema Sworn In as Interim President of Gabon
events.wd_description: Gabon's military junta leader, General Brice Nguema, was sworn in as the interim president by Gabon's constitutional court following a coup that ousted President Ali Bongo.
events.description: Gabon's military junta leader, General Brice Nguema, was sworn in as the interim president by Gabon's constitutional court following a coup that ousted President Ali Bongo.

events.name: Swearing-In Ceremony
events.wd_description: General Brice Nguema was sworn in as the interim president of Gabon by the constitutional court.
events.description: General Brice Nguema was sworn in as the interim president of Gabon by the constitutional court.

events.name: Background of the Coup
events.wd_description: General Brice Nguema led a coup that ousted President Ali Bongo, ending the Bongo family's long reign. President Bongo had been declared the winner of a controversial presidential election marred by voting delays and internet cuts.
events.description: General Brice Nguema led a coup that ousted President Ali Bongo, ending the Bongo family's long reign. President Bongo had been declared the winner of a controversial presidential election marred by voting delays and internet cuts.

events.name: Public Reaction
events.wd_description: The coup led to celebrations in Gabon, with many supporters expressing solidarity with the military.
events.description: The coup led to celebrations in Gabon, with many supporters expressing solidarity with the military.

events.name: Actions by Gen. Brice Nguema
events.wd_description: General Brice Nguema, Bongo’s former bodyguard, was swiftly installed as the transitional leader. He approved the reopening of Gabon’s borders ahead of his swearing-in and met with political leaders to discuss reform and a possible transitional period.
events.description: General Brice Nguema, Bongo’s former bodyguard, was swiftly installed as the transitional leader. He approved the reopening of Gabon’s borders ahead of his swearing-in and met with political leaders to discuss reform and a possible transitional period.

events.name: U.S. to Supply Ukraine with Advanced Long-Range Missiles
events.wd_label: U.S. to Supply Ukraine with Advanced Long-Range Missiles
events.wd_description: The United States plans to supply Ukraine with advanced long-range missiles, including ATACMS, to assist Kyiv in its ongoing counter-offensive against Russian forces.
events.description: The United States plans to supply Ukraine with advanced long-range missiles, including ATACMS, to assist Kyiv in its ongoing counter-offensive against Russian forces.

events.name: Announcement by President Joe Biden
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden announced plans to provide Ukraine with advanced long-range missiles after meeting with Ukrainian officials at the White House.
events.description: President Joe Biden announced plans to provide Ukraine with advanced long-range missiles after meeting with Ukrainian officials at the White House.

events.name: Details of the ATACMS Missiles
events.wd_description: Ukraine will receive ATACMS missiles, which have a range of up to 190 miles (300km), enabling them to hit Russian targets deep behind the front line.
events.description: Ukraine will receive ATACMS missiles, which have a range of up to 190 miles (300km), enabling them to hit Russian targets deep behind the front line.

events.name: Recent Ukrainian Missile Strikes
events.wd_description: On Friday, two of Ukraine’s missiles struck Russia’s Black Sea fleet headquarters using Storm Shadow missiles supplied by Britain and France.
events.description: On Friday, two of Ukraine’s missiles struck Russia’s Black Sea fleet headquarters using Storm Shadow missiles supplied by Britain and France.

events.name: New Military Aid Package
events.wd_description: Ukraine will receive a new tranche of $325 million in military aid, including artillery and ammunition, as part of the support announced by President Biden.
events.description: Ukraine will receive a new tranche of $325 million in military aid, including artillery and ammunition, as part of the support announced by President Biden.

events.name: EV Battery Recycling Investments
events.wd_description: Automakers and companies are increasing investments in EV battery recycling to reduce reliance on critical raw materials such as cobalt, lithium, and nickel.
events.description: Automakers and companies are increasing investments in EV battery recycling to reduce reliance on critical raw materials such as cobalt, lithium, and nickel.

events.name: Redwood Materials Funding
events.wd_description: Redwood Materials received a $2 billion loan commitment from the Department of Energy to expand its battery materials recycling capacity.
events.description: Redwood Materials received a $2 billion loan commitment from the Department of Energy to expand its battery materials recycling capacity.

events.name: Industry Partnerships
events.wd_description: Ford and Volvo have signed an agreement with Redwood Materials to recycle end-of-life battery packs from hybrid and electric vehicles in California.
events.description: Ford and Volvo have signed an agreement with Redwood Materials to recycle end-of-life battery packs from hybrid and electric vehicles in California.

events.name: Impact on Material Costs
events.wd_description: Recycling efforts could reduce the costs of producing new batteries, which was roughly $153/kWh in 2022, by recovering critical raw materials from end-of-life EV batteries.
events.description: Recycling efforts could reduce the costs of producing new batteries, which was roughly $153/kWh in 2022, by recovering critical raw materials from end-of-life EV batteries.

events.name: Recycling Efficiency
events.wd_description: Redwood Materials can recover roughly 95% of nickel, cobalt, lithium, and copper from end-of-life EV batteries, which can be used to manufacture cathode and anode materials for new batteries.
events.description: Redwood Materials can recover roughly 95% of nickel, cobalt, lithium, and copper from end-of-life EV batteries, which can be used to manufacture cathode and anode materials for new batteries.

events.name: Redwood Materials' Circular Supply Chain
events.wd_description: Redwood Materials aims to create a circular supply chain in the U.S. by recovering critical raw materials from electric vehicle batteries at their end-of-life.
events.description: Redwood Materials aims to create a circular supply chain in the U.S. by recovering critical raw materials from electric vehicle batteries at their end-of-life.

events.name: Material Recovery Efficiency
events.wd_description: Redwood says it can recover approximately 95% of nickel, cobalt, lithium, and copper from end-of-life EV batteries.
events.description: Redwood says it can recover approximately 95% of nickel, cobalt, lithium, and copper from end-of-life EV batteries.

events.name: Future Production Goals
events.wd_description: Redwood aims to produce 100 GWh of cathode and anode components per year by 2025, with a target of 500 GWh a year by 2030.
events.description: Redwood aims to produce 100 GWh of cathode and anode components per year by 2025, with a target of 500 GWh a year by 2030.

events.name: Strategic Partnerships
events.wd_description: Tesla’s battery supplier, Panasonic, plans to use recycled cathode materials supplied by Redwood to produce batteries at its new factory in Kansas starting in 2025.
events.description: Tesla’s battery supplier, Panasonic, plans to use recycled cathode materials supplied by Redwood to produce batteries at its new factory in Kansas starting in 2025.

events.name: Economic Impact of Domestic Production
events.wd_description: Without sufficient U.S. production of cathode and anode materials, domestic battery cell manufacturers may offshore over $150 billion in economic value by 2030.
events.description: Without sufficient U.S. production of cathode and anode materials, domestic battery cell manufacturers may offshore over $150 billion in economic value by 2030.

events.name: Loss of Economic Value
events.wd_description: Domestic battery cell manufacturers risk offshoring over $150 billion in economic value for anode and cathode components by 2030 without sufficient U.S. production.
events.description: Domestic battery cell manufacturers risk offshoring over $150 billion in economic value for anode and cathode components by 2030 without sufficient U.S. production.

events.name: Importance of Domestic Production
events.wd_description: Increasing domestic production of cathode and anode materials is crucial for maintaining economic value and reducing reliance on foreign supply chains.
events.description: Increasing domestic production of cathode and anode materials is crucial for maintaining economic value and reducing reliance on foreign supply chains.
